required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: MicroPort® Endoscopic Instrument Control System to Accomplish Robotic-assisted Surgery in Urology
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Studies of Robotic-assisted Surgery in Urology With MicroPort® Endoscopic Instrument Control System

brief_summary.textblock: Laparoscopy, now virtually completely, was replaced with robotic surgery in uro-oncological surgery in the world. And given the significant increase in the number of robotic surgeries for prostate, bladder and kidney cancer, it is now a major domain in oncological surgery. Microport MedBot Inc. has independently developed a domestic surgical robot in China. Therefore, the purpose of the study is to evaluate the safety and efficacy of the Chinese robot when applied to surgery in oncology.

primary_outcome.description: Surgery is completed without conversion to other operations and without a re-operation caused by intraoperative complications within 24 hours

secondary_outcome.description: Amount of intraoperative bleeding in the patient from the start to the end of the operation
The starting point and end point of the operation time are the first effective movement of the robot arm and the movement stop of the robot arm after the operation.
The total hospital days of subjects from the day of the operation to discharge.
The overall incidence of intraoperative and postoperative complications.

secondary_outcome.measure: The physiological load of the surgeon during the surgery
secondary_outcome.description: The physiological load is assessed by the LED scale immediately after the surgery. LED is the local experienced discomfort scale used to assess the intraoperative physiological load of different parts of the surgeon's body. There are 10 points in the scale, and higher score means worse, with 0 means no discomfort and 10 is the worst discomfort.

secondary_outcome.measure: The psychological load of the surgeon during the surgery
secondary_outcome.description: The psychological load is assessed by the SME scale immediately after the operation. SME scale is the subjective mental effort scale used to assess the intraoperative psychological load of the surgeon. The scale has a total of 150 points, with a scale of 10 points. The higher the score, the worse it is, with 0 means no any difficult and above 110 points means extremely difficult.

secondary_outcome.measure: the critical failure rate of the robotic system
secondary_outcome.description: Critical failures that are difficult to repair in a short period of time during robot-assisted surgery and can have a serious impact on the process or the operation

secondary_outcome.measure: the recoverable malfunction rate of the robotic system
secondary_outcome.description: Recoverable malfunction meant minor errors that could be easily resolved by the technician and has no significant impact on the process or the operation
The researcher fills in the instrument performance evaluation form after the operation to review the performance of the instrument during the test.

arm_group.description: robot-assisted surgeries, for instance, prostatectomy, cystectomy or nephrectomy will be performed using MicroPort® surgical system
robot-assisted surgeries, for instance, prostatectomy, cystectomy or nephrectomy will be performed using da Vinci surgical system

intervention.description: In this group, patients undergoing robot-assisted laparoscopic surgery in urology will be performed by Microport® Surgical System
In this group, patients undergoing robot-assisted laparoscopic surgery in urology will be performed by da Vinci Surgical System

facility.name: Renji Hospital Affiliated to Shanghai Jiaotong University School of Medicine
The first affiliated hospital of naval medical university (Shanghai changhai hospital)
Zhongshan Hospital Affiliated to Fudan University
